about_the_game:
Cosmo's industry is all about capitalism, that's why you either adapt or join the other's under the overpass huddled next to a trashcan fire. 

You as a new business owner, or I guess old business owner have the task of not only surviving the vast emptiness of space, but also satisfy your customers no mater what weird and disgusting thing they may need. So be ready to work you ass off until you achieve wealth or die trying. 

Despite space being a lonely place you wont be alone and the only company you'll have is not only the customers you may come across but also your business partner/employee/the responsible one/maintenance guy. He may seem friendly but don't piss him off because he is the only reason your shop is still standing (even though the state its in isn't all that impressive).

Cosmos industry is a point and click, venture capitalist, "survival", but most importantly it's a recourse management challenge, you are free to chose the way you play whether it be slow and relaxed while enjoying the journey of making money, friends, and most of all product, or become a multi millionaire within a few days and throw money at any problem you may have. However you play there are no wrong answers, but remember, this isn't "Hobo - tough life" so go make your millions.

Now some real talk: "This is my first real game, please be gentle" said the developer. But ignore his weak mentality, no matter what you don't like, even the smallest of annoyances please leave a comment, review, social media or find his house and pin the complaint to his door but no mater what let him know where to improve so that you get your moneys worth no mater what. And do the same if you have any questions about the game before buying, advice on what you would like to see added or changed or just what to talk. 

As the last paragraph begins the description ends and the only words I have for anyone who actuality read that, I hope you enjoy playing the game as much as I did making it (yes In the previous paragraph I did refer to my self in the 3rd person and encouraged bullying me).
detailed_description:
Cosmo's industry is all about capitalism, that's why you either adapt or join the other's under the overpass huddled next to a trashcan fire. 

You as a new business owner, or I guess old business owner have the task of not only surviving the vast emptiness of space, but also satisfy your customers no mater what weird and disgusting thing they may need. So be ready to work you ass off until you achieve wealth or die trying. 

Despite space being a lonely place you wont be alone and the only company you'll have is not only the customers you may come across but also your business partner/employee/the responsible one/maintenance guy. He may seem friendly but don't piss him off because he is the only reason your shop is still standing (even though the state its in isn't all that impressive).

Cosmos industry is a point and click, venture capitalist, "survival", but most importantly it's a recourse management challenge, you are free to chose the way you play whether it be slow and relaxed while enjoying the journey of making money, friends, and most of all product, or become a multi millionaire within a few days and throw money at any problem you may have. However you play there are no wrong answers, but remember, this isn't "Hobo - tough life" so go make your millions.

Now some real talk: "This is my first real game, please be gentle" said the developer. But ignore his weak mentality, no matter what you don't like, even the smallest of annoyances please leave a comment, review, social media or find his house and pin the complaint to his door but no mater what let him know where to improve so that you get your moneys worth no mater what. And do the same if you have any questions about the game before buying, advice on what you would like to see added or changed or just what to talk. 

As the last paragraph begins the description ends and the only words I have for anyone who actuality read that, I hope you enjoy playing the game as much as I did making it (yes In the previous paragraph I did refer to my self in the 3rd person and encouraged bullying me).
name: Cosmo's Industry

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows 7, 8, 10, 11 x64
  • Processor: Intel Core i3
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 2.1 compatible graphics card, integrated graphics

short_description: Cosmo's Industry is a point-and-click, inventory-management adventure where you run an old, run-down shop that was abandoned by its previous owner. With the facilities damaged or lost entirely, it's your job and pleasure to recover as much as you can while satisfying the needs of your customers.
